Radial nerve

Radial nerve arises from the posterior cord of the brachial plexus and runs deep to the axillary artery before passing behind the humerus in the spiral groove. It then enters the antecubital fossa between brachialis and brachioradialis where it divides into terminal branches. The xxx branch follows lateral to the radial artery into the hand.

It provides motor innervation to the extensors of the forearm and hand. Cutaneous sensory distribution is limited xxx, but deep sensation covers much of the hand and radial side of the forearm.
